heading: Uli was featured on Github Open Source Friday
para: Denny and Kaustubha were interviewed by Andrea from Github for their weekly show . We got to share how Uli came about, our plans for it in the future, and our take on interdisciplinary work in tech.

heading: TrustCon 2024 - Participatory Algorithmic Moderation
para: We gave a presentation at TrustCon 2024 on participatory algorithmic moderation. The presentation focused on participatory processes for creating representative datasets.

heading: Uli is a DPG now
para: We are thrilled to be counted as a Digital Public Good alongside many other incredible opensource projects working to achieve the SDGs.

heading: Outstanding Paper Award for Uli!
para: Uli received global recognition for its unique approach to annotation. The academic write-up that explains this process received the Outstanding Paper Award at the Workshop on Online Abuse and Harms, held at the NAACL 2024

heading: Thank You for Reporting: Mitigating Online Harms with Accessible Technology
para: This discussion was hosted at the Tinkerspace, Kerala, alongside RATI Foundation. Rati spoke about their helpline for children and women facing online harms in India, Meri Helpline, and Tattle spoke about building citizen-centric technologies against these threats.

heading: Asia Disinformation Co-Lab
para: Tattle participated in the Asia Disinformation Co-Lab in Bangkok put together by Numun Fund. The event gathered researchers, activists, media practitioners, designers, and developers from across Asia and aimed to enhance analysis and action against disinformation and hate speech by exploring concrete strategies to tackle disinformation and the sharing of insights, experiences, and recommendations.

heading: Safeguarding Information Integrity during Elections with Digital Public Goods
para: Feluda was featured and listed in a blog by the Digital Public Goods Alliance on DPGs that are strengthening information integrity at the critical time of elections.

heading: AoIR Hyderabad Flashpoint Symposium 2024
para: Tattle took part in a panel themed on building a more just and fair internet through design, code, and content as part of the symposium that was centred on exploring forms and structures of labour contributing to digital infrastructures, content, and systems.

heading: Launch of DAU Collaborative Platform
para: Collaborating with the Misinformation Combat Alliance, we're addressing the issue of manipulated media through a WhatsApp tipline (Deepfakes Analysis Unit) for querying media manipulation levels, providing assessment reports for each item. Our focus is on the collaborative platform powering the Deepfakes Analysis Unit, facilitating collective assessment among experts

heading: Consultation on Gendered Information Disorder in India
para: We attended the roundtable held by Centre for Internet and Society and Point of View in Mumbai, and had some interesting discussions whereby intersectional perspectives were brought forth in an attempt to understand the impact of gender upon information disorders.

heading: Ballots and Bots: Elections 2024 in a Digital World
para: We took part in an in-person event hosted by Software Freedom Law Centre that emphasized the pivotal role of technology in India's upcoming 2024 General Elections, particularly in shaping electoral processes.

heading: Uli slur list used by IFF
para: Uli's slur list was used by IFF to identify real examples of gendered hate speech content in English and Hindi on Youtube and Koo

heading: Deepfakes and Democracy
para: Tattle participated in a virtual event hosted by Medianama that centred on discussing the regulatory challenges and societal implications posed by deepfakes on democracy, exploring solutions and collaborative strategies

heading: Shared Task on Gendered Abuse Detection in Indic Languages at ICON
para: A shared task based on the Uli Dataset to build NLP systems that detect online gender-based violence

heading: Community-Led AI - Notes from the Trenches
para: Presentation at the Research Symposium of the Global Partnership on AI 2023 conference

heading: Design Thinking Session on Digitally Manipulated Media
para: We published a work in progress open dataset of Manipulated Media items that spread on social media. We also published a strategy document on ways of mitigating harms by DMM

heading: Uli UX Improvements and Security Updates
Is meaningful participation and accountability in AI possible?
para: A discussion centred around creating more space for participation by those outside of the tech field in the design, testing, deployment, and assessment of AI and ML models

heading: What Do We Mean When We Say Open-Source AI
para: A talk at IndiaFOSS 3.0 in Bangalore about the world of Open Source AI

heading: Community Participation in Hacktoberfest
para: We improved our documentation and secured 3 community merged PRs with hacktoberfest contributors in Uli

heading: Data Cooperatives and Open Source AI
para: Hosted a webinar on data and ML model licencing as part of Open Source Initiative's Deep Dive AI Webinar Series

heading: Feluda's Recognition as a DPG
para: Our tool, Feluda, has been officially recognised by the Digital Public Goods Alliance as a DPG

heading: Keynote at ADMS Symposium: Alternative Visions for Tech in the Age of AI
para: The talk focused on the importance of civic tech to healthier digital futures

heading: DPG Open Source Community Manager Programme
para: Uli took part in GitHub's efforts to popularise contributions to tech projects that work for the social good

heading: Mobile Communication and Online Falsehoods in Asia
para: The chapter written by Denny, Tarunima and Aditya speaks about the unique technical and social affordances of Mobile Instant Messaging Services (like WhatsApp) which, if accounted for, can result in a more productive agenda for protecting Indian citizens on these platforms

heading: A Community-based Tool to Block Hateful Content on Social Media
para: Uli featured by Mozilla Foundation

heading: TinkerHub: Future of AI in India
para: Tattle hosted a session on tech interventions against online harms

heading: RightsCon Costa Rica 2023
para: Tattle alongside GitHub hosted a session on developing indexes on internet platform data for social sector research

heading: Nobel Prize Summit
para: Feluda was one of the nine open-source solutions featured by UNDP and DPGA at the Nobel Prize Summit in Washington DC in an effort to highlight how open-source innovation is helping to address mis- and disinformation around the world and provide better access to reliable information

heading: MisinfoCon India 2023
para: Tattle co-organised the first MisinfoCon conference in India in Bangalore with Meedan and Hackshackers at the Thoughtworks' Bangalore office. It was a convening of technology, policy, media, and design professionals to foster understanding and action around misinformation in India and consisted of two days of lightning talks and workshops, followed by a hackathon on the third day, touching on different aspects of trust and safety online, with a specific focus on platform research, AI and media, storytelling and misinformation response, and gendered disinformation

heading: Digital Rights Asia Pacific 2023 Assembly
para: Tattle hosted two sessions: One was a playtest workshop on Viral Spiral and the second was a roundtable on the impacts and challenges of language models for South Asian Media in the present age of Mis/Disinformation

heading: Tattle's Induction into DATALeads' Factshala Innovation Lab
para: Tattle being supported to develop a game centred around imparting media literacy

heading: Putting hate speech on mute: An Indian project helps social media users filter out abuse to feel safe online
para: Uli featured by DW Akademie

heading: Global AI: Reframing the Conversation
para: Event that focused on reframing the conversation around AI and the need to move beyond looking at AI as this all-knowing, pervasive being

heading: Civic Tech Workshop at FLAME University
para: Workshop conducted with first-year Digital Humanities students at FLAME University in Pune, India, about civic tech, its role in society and how Tattle contributes to the space

heading: Tattle's Participation at Mozfest
para: Included three sessions on fair compensation for data annotators, our DFL induction, and designing federated networks around user experiences

heading: Centering Womens Equity in Digital Technology
para: UN CSW event that focused on digital technology solutions for challenges that people who identify as women and girls disproportionately face globally

heading: Tattle's Induction into the Data Futures Lab Cohort
para: Uli project being supported by Mozilla to develop crowdsourced datasets for the public good

heading: Viral Spiral playtest with college students
para: Playtesting Viral Spiral with college students at Mathrubhumi Media School as part of a workshop facilitated by Citizen Digital Foundation

heading: Induction into Agami's OpenNyAI Labs Cohort
para: Tattle's try at utilising LLMs to build an AI product

heading: Can digital games like Viral Spiral fight fake news and misinformation?
para: Viral Spiral featured by Mint

heading: Tech for Truth: Innovative Solutions
para: Misinformation Regulations Governance at IIT-Madras

heading: Safe and Unsafe: How Design Choices Help Women Online
para: IIC Diamond Jubilee Celebrations - Digital Governance

heading: MP Presented GFTW study's Findings at Academic Conference
para: Behavioural Research in Economics Workshop at IIM-Bangalore

heading: Attended Agami Summit Convened for Idea Prize Shortlisted Members
para: Agami Summit 2022: Big Ideas for Justice

heading: Ironing out Creases and Listening to Community Feedback for Viral Spiral
para: Viral Spiral's First Digital Playtest Session

heading: Presentation at UNFPA Consultation
para: Tackling Tech-Mediated Online Gender-Based Violence

heading: Submitted Comments on the Indian Telecommunications Bill, 2022
para: Open Consultation on Indian Telecommunications Bill, 2022

heading: Initiating Community Outreach for Uli
para: Winning Feminist ki Batti Jalao Grant

heading: How Tattle And Hatebase Tackle Online Misinformation And Hate Speech In Non-English Languages
para: Tattle Interviewed by Medianama

heading: Medium and the message: Spread of hate through misinformation & disinformation
